 31 |

 34 |

 42 |             full_name=request.data.full_name.value if request.data.HasField("full_name") else None,
 43 |             phone_number=request.data.phone_number.value if request.data.HasField("phone_number") else None
 44 |         )

 51 |

 58 |             phone_number=request.data.phone_number.value if request.data.HasField("phone_number") else None
 59 |         )

 160 |     @asynccontextmanager
 161 |     async def _request_context(
 162 |         self, operation_name: str, request_id: Optional[str] = None
 163 |     ):
 164 |         """Context manager for request handling with metrics and logging."""
 165 |         if not request_id:
 166 |             request_id = str(uuid4())
 167 | 
 168 |         start_time = time.time()
 169 |         self._metrics["requests_total"] += 1
 170 | 
 171 |         self.logger.info(f"[{request_id}] Starting {operation_name}")
 172 | 
 173 |         try:
 174 |             yield request_id
 175 |             self._metrics["requests_success"] += 1
 176 |         except Exception as e:
 177 |             self._metrics["requests_error"] += 1
 178 |             self.logger.error(
 179 |                 f"[{request_id}] Error in {operation_name}: {e}", exc_info=True
 180 |             )
 181 |             raise
 182 |         finally:
 183 |             duration = time.time() - start_time
 184 |             self._update_avg_response_time(duration)
 185 |             self.logger.info(
 186 |                 f"[{request_id}] Completed {operation_name} in {duration:.3f}s"
 187 |             )
 188 | 
 189 |     def _update_avg_response_time(self, duration: float):
 190 |         """Update average response time metric."""
 191 |         current_avg = self._metrics["avg_response_time"]
 192 |         total_requests = self._metrics["requests_total"]
 193 | 
 194 |         if total_requests == 1:
 195 |             self._metrics["avg_response_time"] = duration
 196 |         else:
 197 |             # Simple moving average
 198 |             self._metrics["avg_response_time"] = (
 199 |                 current_avg * (total_requests - 1) + duration
 200 |             ) / total_requests

 781 |     def _handle_validation_exception(
 782 |         self, exception: ValidationException, request_id: str, response_class, context
 783 |     ):
 784 |         """Handle validation exceptions by returning a standardized error payload.
 785 | 
 786 |         We intentionally do NOT set a non-OK gRPC status here so that HTTP gateways
 787 |         can forward the structured error response body with code/message/data.
 788 |         """
 789 |         return self._create_error_response(
 790 |             response_class, exception.message, request_id, code=400
 791 |         )
 792 | 
 793 |     def _handle_domain_exception(
 794 |         self, exception: DomainException, request_id: str, response_class, context
 795 |     ):
 796 |         """Handle domain exceptions by returning a standardized error payload.
 797 | 
 798 |         Do not set gRPC non-OK status; embed error in response body so gateways
 799 |         return JSON like { code, message, data: null }.
 800 |         """
 801 |         # Map domain error_code to HTTP-style code in payload
 802 |         error_code_map = {
 803 |             "EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS": 409,
 804 |             "USERNAME_ALREADY_EXISTS": 409,
 805 |             "USER_NOT_FOUND": 404,
 806 |             "INVALID_CREDENTIALS": 401,
 807 |             "FORBIDDEN": 403,
 808 |             "UNAUTHORIZED": 401,
 809 |             "VALIDATION_ERROR": 400,
 810 |             "BUSINESS_RULE_VIOLATION": 400,
 811 |         }
 812 |         code = error_code_map.get(getattr(exception, "error_code", ""), 400)
 813 |         return self._create_error_response(
 814 |             response_class, exception.message, request_id, code=code
 815 |         )
 816 | 
 817 |     def _handle_unexpected_exception(
 818 |         self, exception: Exception, request_id: str, response_class, context
 819 |     ):
 820 |         """Handle unexpected exceptions by returning a 500-style payload."""
 821 |         return self._create_error_response(
 822 |             response_class, "An unexpected error occurred", request_id, code=500
 823 |         )
 824 | 
 825 |     def _create_error_response(
 826 |         self, response_class, error_message: str, request_id: str, code: int = 400
 827 |     ):
 828 |         """Create standardized error response with consistent timestamp precision."""
 829 |         from datetime import datetime
 830 | 
 831 |         try:
 832 |             return response_class(
 833 |                 response_id=str(uuid4()),
 834 |                 timestamp=datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + "Z",
 835 |                 reference_id=request_id,
 836 |                 code=code,
 837 |                 message=error_message,
 838 |                 data=None,
 839 |             )
 840 |         except Exception:
 841 |             return response_class()
